verses.verse: After <WG1161> two <WG1417> days <WG2250> was <WG2258> the feast of the passover <WG3957>, and <WG2532> of <WG3326> unleavened bread <WG106>: and <WG2532> the chief priests <WG749> and <WG2532> the scribes <WG1122> sought <WG2212> how <WG4459> they might take <WG2902> him <WG846> by <WG1722> craft <WG1388>, and put him to death <WG615>.
But <WG1161> they said <WG3004>, Not <WG3361> on <WG1722> the feast <WG1859> day, lest <WG3379> there be <WG2071> an uproar <WG2351> of the people <WG2992>.

And <WG2532> being <WG846> <WG5607> in <WG1722> Bethany <WG963> in <WG1722> the house <WG3614> of Simon <WG4613> the leper <WG3015>, as he <WG846> sat at meat <WG2621>, there came <WG2064> a woman <WG1135> having <WG2192> an alabaster box <WG211> of ointment <WG3464> of spikenard <WG3487> <WG4101> very precious <WG4185>; and <WG2532> she brake <WG4937> the box <WG211>, and poured <WG2708> it on <WG2596> his <WG846> head <WG2776>. spikenard: or, pure nard, or, liquid nard

And <WG1161> there were <WG2258> some <WG5100> that had indignation <WG23> within <WG4314> themselves <WG1438>, and <WG2532> said <WG3004>, Why <WG1519> <WG5101> was <WG1096> this <WG3778> waste <WG684> of the ointment <WG3464> made <WG1096>?

For <WG1063> it <WG5124> might <WG1410> have been sold <WG4097> for more than <WG1883> three hundred <WG5145> pence <WG1220>, and <WG2532> have been given <WG1325> to the poor <WG4434>. And <WG2532> they murmured against <WG1690> her <WG846>.

And <WG1161> Jesus <WG2424> said <WG2036>, Let <WG863> her <WG846> alone <WG863>; why <WG5101> trouble ye <WG2873> <WG3930> her <WG846>? she hath wrought <WG2038> a good <WG2570> work <WG2041> on <WG1519> me <WG1691>.

For <WG1063> ye have <WG2192> the poor <WG4434> with <WG3326> you <WG1438> always <WG3842>, and <WG2532> whensoever <WG3752> ye will <WG2309> ye may <WG1410> do <WG4160> them <WG846> good <WG2095>: but <WG1161> me <WG1691> ye have <WG2192> not <WG3756> always <WG3842>.
She hath done <WG4160> what <WG3739> she <WG3778> <WG846> could <WG2192>: she is come aforehand <WG4301> to anoint <WG3462> my <WG3450> body <WG4983> to <WG1519> the burying <WG1780>.

Verily <WG281> I say <WG3004> unto you <WG5213>, Wheresoever <WG3699> <WG302> this <WG5124> gospel <WG2098> shall be preached <WG2784> throughout <WG1519> the whole <WG3650> world <WG2889>, this also <WG2532> that <WG3739> she <WG3778> <WG846> hath done <WG4160> shall be spoken <WG2980> of for <WG1519> a memorial <WG3422> of her <WG846>.
And <WG2532> Judas <WG2455> Iscariot <WG2469>, one <WG1520> of the twelve <WG1427>, went <WG565> unto <WG4314> the chief priests <WG749>, to <WG2443> betray <WG3860> him <WG846> unto them <WG846>.

And <WG1161> when they heard <WG191> it, they were glad <WG5463>, and <WG2532> promised <WG1861> to give <WG1325> him <WG846> money <WG694>. And <WG2532> he sought <WG2212> how <WG4459> he might conveniently <WG2122> betray <WG3860> him <WG846>.

And <WG2532> he sendeth forth <WG649> two <WG1417> of his <WG846> disciples <WG3101>, and <WG2532> saith <WG3004> unto them <WG846>, Go ye <WG5217> into <WG1519> the city <WG4172>, and <WG2532> there shall meet <WG528> you <WG5213> a man <WG444> bearing <WG941> a pitcher <WG2765> of water <WG5204>: follow <WG190> him <WG846>.

And <WG2532> wheresoever <WG3699> <WG1437> he shall go in <WG1525>, say ye <WG2036> to the goodman of the house <WG3617>, <WG3754> The Master <WG1320> saith <WG3004>, Where <WG4226> is <WG2076> the guestchamber <WG2646>, where <WG3699> I shall eat <WG5315> the passover <WG3957> with <WG3326> my <WG3450> disciples <WG3101>?

And <WG2532> in <WG1096> the evening <WG3798> he cometh <WG2064> with <WG3326> the twelve <WG1427>.

And <WG2532> as they <WG846> sat <WG345> and <WG2532> did eat <WG2068>, Jesus <WG2424> said <WG2036>, Verily <WG281> I say <WG3004> unto you <WG5213>, <WG3754> One <WG1520> of <WG1537> you <WG5216> which <WG3588> eateth <WG2068> with <WG3326> me <WG1700> shall betray <WG3860> me <WG3165>.

And <WG1161> they began <WG756> to be sorrowful <WG3076>, and to <WG2532> say <WG3004> unto him <WG846> one by one <WG1527>, <WG3385> Is it I <WG1473>? and <WG2532> another <WG243> said, <WG3385> Is it I <WG1473>?

And <WG1161> he answered <WG611> and said <WG2036> unto them <WG846>, It is one <WG1520> of <WG1537> the twelve <WG1427>, that dippeth <WG1686> with <WG3326> me <WG1700> in <WG1519> the dish <WG5165>.

The Son <WG5207> of man <WG444> indeed <WG3303> goeth <WG5217>, as <WG2531> it is written <WG1125> of <WG4012> him <WG846>: but <WG1161> woe <WG3759> to that <WG1565> man <WG444> by <WG1223> whom <WG3739> the Son <WG5207> of man <WG444> is betrayed <WG3860>! good <WG2570> were it <WG2258> for that <WG1565> man <WG444> if <WG1487> he <WG846> had <WG1080> never <WG3756> been born <WG1080>.

And <WG2532> he took <WG2983> the cup <WG4221>, and when he had given thanks <WG2168>, he gave <WG1325> it to them <WG846>: and <WG2532> they all <WG3956> drank <WG4095> of <WG1537> it <WG846>.

And <WG2532> when they had sung an hymn <WG5214>, they went out <WG1831> into <WG1519> the mount <WG3735> of Olives <WG1636>. hymn: or, psalm

And <WG1161> they laid <WG1911> their <WG846> hands <WG5495> on <WG1909> him <WG846>, and <WG2532> took <WG2902> him <WG846>.

For <WG1063> many <WG4183> bare false witness <WG5576> against <WG2596> him <WG846>, but <WG2532> their witness <WG3141> agreed <WG2258> not <WG2470> <WG3756> together <WG2258>.

But <WG2532> neither <WG3761> so <WG3779> did <WG2470> their <WG846> witness <WG3141> agree together <WG2258> <WG2470>.

And <WG2532> as Peter <WG4074> was <WG5607> beneath <WG2736> in <WG1722> the palace <WG833>, there cometh <WG2064> one <WG3391> of the maids <WG3814> of the high priest <WG749>:

And <WG2532> when she saw <WG1492> Peter <WG4074> warming himself <WG2328>, she looked <WG1689> upon him <WG846>, and said <WG3004>, And <WG2532> thou <WG4771> also <WG2532> wast <WG2258> with <WG3326> Jesus <WG2424> of Nazareth <WG3479>.
